annotations.description: Application template for an ephemeral authoring and testing environment, for Red Hat Decision Manager 7.3
annotations.openshift.io/display-name: Red Hat Decision Manager 7.3 ephemeral trial environment
annotations.template.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines resources needed for an ephemeral authoring and testing environment for Red Hat Decision Manager 7.3, including application deployment configuration, secure and insecure http communication.

annotations.description: All the Decision Central web server's ports.
All the KIE server web server's ports.
Route for Decision Central's http service.
Route for KIE server's http service.

parameters.description: The name for the application.
parameters.name: APPLICATION_NAME

parameters.description: Default password used for multiple components for user convenience in this trial environment.
parameters.name: DEFAULT_PASSWORD

parameters.description: KIE administrator username.
parameters.name: KIE_ADMIN_USER

parameters.description: KIE server username. (Sets the org.kie.server.user system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_USER

parameters.description: Allows the KIE server to bypass the authenticated user for task related operations e.g. queries. (Sets the org.kie.server.bypass.auth.user system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_BYPASS_AUTH_USER

parameters.description: KIE server controller username. (Sets the org.kie.server.controller.user system property)
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTROLLER_USER

parameters.description: The KIE Server mode. Valid values are 'DEVELOPMENT' or 'PRODUCTION'. In production mode, you can not deploy SNAPSHOT versions of artifacts on the KIE server and can not change the version of an artifact in an existing container. (Sets the org.kie.server.mode system property).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MODE

parameters.description: KIE server mbeans enabled/disabled. (Sets the kie.mbeans and kie.scanner.mbeans system properties)
parameters.name: KIE_MBEANS

parameters.description: KIE server class filtering. (Sets the org.drools.server.filter.classes system property)
parameters.name: DROOLS_SERVER_FILTER_CLASSES

parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route. Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>-kieserver-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>
parameters.displayName: KIE Server Custom http Route Hostname
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_HOSTNAME_HTTP

parameters.description: Sets the Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header value in the KIE Server (useful for CORS support).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ACCESS_CONTROL_ALLOW_ORIGIN

parameters.description: Sets the Access-Control-Allow-Methods response header value in the KIE Server (useful for CORS support).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ACCESS_CONTROL_ALLOW_METHODS

parameters.description: Sets the Access-Control-Allow-Headers response header value in the KIE Server (useful for CORS support).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ACCESS_CONTROL_ALLOW_HEADERS

parameters.description: Sets the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials response header value in the KIE Server (useful for CORS support).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ACCESS_CONTROL_ALLOW_CREDENTIALS

parameters.description: Sets the Access-Control-Max-Age response header value in the KIE Server (useful for CORS support).
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_ACCESS_CONTROL_MAX_AGE

parameters.description: Custom hostname for http service route.  Leave blank for default hostname, e.g.: <application-name>-rhdmcentr-<project>.<default-domain-suffix>
parameters.displayName: Decision Central Custom http Route Hostname
parameters.name: DECISION_CENTRAL_HOSTNAME_HTTP

parameters.description: Namespace in which the ImageStreams for Red Hat Middleware images are installed. These ImageStreams are normally installed in the openshift namespace. You should only need to modify this if you installed the ImageStreams in a different namespace/project.
parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_NAMESPACE

parameters.description: The name of the image stream to use for KIE server. Default is "rhdm73-kieserver-openshift".
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_IMAGE_STREAM_NAME

parameters.description: A named pointer to an image in an image stream. Default is "1.1".
parameters.name: IMAGE_STREAM_TAG

parameters.description: KIE Server Container deployment configuration in format: containerId=groupId:artifactId:version|c2=g2:a2:v2
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_CONTAINER_DEPLOYMENT

parameters.description: The id to use for the maven repository, if set. Default is generated randomly.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_ID

parameters.description: Fully qualified URL to a Maven repository or service.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_URL

parameters.description: Username to access the Maven repository, if required.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_USERNAME

parameters.description: Password to access the Maven repository, if required.
parameters.name: MAVEN_REPO_PASSWORD

parameters.description: Username to access the Maven service hosted by Decision Central inside EAP.
parameters.displayName: Username for the Maven service hosted by Decision Central
parameters.name: DECISION_CENTRAL_MAVEN_USERNAME

parameters.description: The directory to use for git hooks, if required.
parameters.name: GIT_HOOKS_DIR

parameters.description: Decision Central Container memory limit.
parameters.name: DECISION_CENTRAL_MEMORY_LIMIT

parameters.description: KIE server Container memory limit.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_MEMORY_LIMIT

parameters.description: RH-SSO URL.
parameters.name: SSO_URL

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm name.
parameters.name: SSO_REALM

parameters.description: Decision Central RH-SSO Client name.
parameters.name: DECISION_CENTRAL_SSO_CLIENT

parameters.description: Decision Central RH-SSO Client Secret.
parameters.name: DECISION_CENTRAL_SSO_SECRET

parameters.description: KIE Server RH-SSO Client name.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_SSO_CLIENT

parameters.description: KIE Server RH-SSO Client Secret.
parameters.name: KIE_SERVER_SSO_SECRET

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Username used to create the Client if it doesn't exist.
parameters.name: SSO_USERNAME

parameters.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Password used to create the Client.
parameters.name: SSO_PASSWORD

parameters.description: RH-SSO Disable SSL Certificate Validation.
parameters.name: SSO_DISABLE_SSL_CERTIFICATE_VALIDATION

parameters.description: RH-SSO Principal Attribute to use as username.
parameters.name: SSO_PRINCIPAL_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.description: LDAP Endpoint to connect for authentication.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_URL

parameters.description: Bind DN used for authentication.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN

parameters.description: LDAP Credentials used for authentication.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BIND_CREDENTIAL

parameters.description: The JMX ObjectName of the JaasSecurityDomain used to decrypt the password.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_JAAS_SECURITY_DOMAIN

parameters.description: LDAP Base DN of the top-level context to begin the user search.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_CTX_DN

parameters.description: LDAP search filter used to locate the context of the user to authenticate. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. A common example for the search filter is (uid={0}).
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_BASE_FILTER

parameters.description: The search scope to use.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_SCOPE

parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds for user or role searches.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_SEARCH_TIME_LIMIT

parameters.description: The name of the attribute in the user entry that contains the DN of the user. This may be necessary if the DN of the user itself contains special characters, backslash for example, that prevent correct user mapping. If the attribute does not exist, the entry’s DN is used.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DISTINGUISHED_NAME_ATTRIBUTE

parameters.description: A flag indicating if the DN is to be parsed for the username. If set to true, the DN is parsed for the username. If set to false the DN is not parsed for the username. This option is used together with usernameBeginString and usernameEndString.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_PARSE_USERNAME

parameters.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the start of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_USERNAME_BEGIN_STRING

parameters.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the end of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_USERNAME_END_STRING

parameters.description: Name of the attribute containing the user roles.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_ID

parameters.description: The fixed DN of the context to search for user roles. This is not the DN where the actual roles are, but the DN where the objects containing the user roles are. For example, in a Microsoft Active Directory server, this is the DN where the user account is.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLES_CTX_DN

parameters.description: A search filter used to locate the roles associated with the authenticated user. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. The authenticated userDN is substituted into the filter anywhere a {1} is used. An example search filter that matches on the input username is (member={0}). An alternative that matches on the authenticated userDN is (member={1}).
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_FILTER

parameters.description: The number of levels of recursion the role search will go below a matching context. Disable recursion by setting this to 0.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_RECURSION

parameters.description: A role included for all authenticated users.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_DEFAULT_ROLE

parameters.description: Name of the attribute within the roleCtxDN context which contains the role name. If the roleAttributeIsDN property is set to true, this property is used to find the role object’s name attribute.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_NAME_ATTRIBUTE_ID

parameters.description: A flag indicating if the DN returned by a query contains the roleNameAttributeID. If set to true, the DN is checked for the roleNameAttributeID. If set to false, the DN is not checked for the roleNameAttributeID. This flag can improve the performance of LDAP queries.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_PARSE_ROLE_NAME_FROM_DN

parameters.description: Whether or not the roleAttributeID contains the fully-qualified DN of a role object. If false, the role name is taken from the value of the roleNameAttributeId attribute of the context name. Certain directory schemas, such as Microsoft Active Directory, require this attribute to be set to true.
parameters.displayName: LDAP Role Attribute ID is DN
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE_IS_DN

parameters.description: If you are not using referrals, you can ignore this option. When using referrals, this option denotes the attribute name which contains users defined for a certain role, for example member, if the role object is inside the referral. Users are checked against the content of this attribute name. If this option is not set, the check will always fail, so role objects cannot be stored in a referral tree.
parameters.name: AUTH_LDAP_REFERRAL_USER_ATTRIBUTE_ID_TO_CHECK

parameters.description: When present, the RoleMapping Login Module will be configured to use the provided file. This parameter defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or resource which maps roles to replacement roles. The format is original_role=role1,role2,role3
parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_ROLES_PROPERTIES

parameters.description: Whether to add to the current roles, or replace the current roles with the mapped ones. Replaces if set to true.
parameters.name: AUTH_ROLE_MAPPER_REPLACE_ROLE
